title_en: Leftist student group calls for two-day nationwide strike over NEET row
summary_en:
Leftist student organizations are calling for a two-day nationwide strike over alleged violations at NEET 2024.
A massive scandal broke out after a record number of students scored the highest scores.
Students claim that they were given inflated scores and question this practice.
The All India Student Association (AISA) is calling for a strike to protest against corruption and mismanagement by the NTA.
A group of 20 students filed an application to the Supreme Court demanding the cancellation of the NEET-UG 2024 exam.
The new petition calls for the CBI or any other independent agency to investigate the alleged violations.
The Central Government and the National Public Relations Office informed the Supreme Court that they had cancelled the preferential grades.

title_en: A wave of demonstrations against the National Group has begun in France
summary_en:
Representatives of trade unions and civil society organizations in France are demonstrating against the rise of the far right.
About 200 demonstrations are planned for Saturday and tomorrow, with a possible participation of 300,000 to 350,000 people.
21,000 police and gendarmes have been mobilized to monitor developments.
French President Emmanuel Macron has announced early parliamentary elections in response to the victory of the far-right group.
Macron's move revolutionized the political board of Gaul.
The demonstrators express their concern and commitment to the cause until the last day of the parliamentary elections.
They criticize the National Group for "fraud" and speculation on racism.

title_en: A new "green wave" of hundreds of people is again demanding "an end to the conflict" in Madrid public education
summary_en:
A new "green wave" has demonstrated in Madrid, calling for an end to the conflict in public education and demanding an industry agreement and a reduction in school hours and coefficients.
The rally was called by the trade unions of the Sectoral Bureau of Education-CC.OO, ANPE, CSIF and UGT.
The educational unions criticized the fact that the adviser on Education, Science and Universities of the Madrid Community, Emilio Visiana, convened them next week for negotiations without a firm proposal or agenda.
The unions are awaiting proposals for study and internal analysis as a result of this meeting, but they also have little hope.
The President of ANPE Madrid noted that the education adviser agrees with the demands of the trade unions, but there is an adviser who refuses to put the money needed to implement these measures on the table.
The demonstration was also attended by the representative of the Majority of Madrid in the Assembly and the Deputy Press Secretary and responsible for education in the Regional Chamber.
Emilio Visiana announced a global pact to improve education, a proposal that proceeds from the premise that it is "reasonable" and "progressive."
